caption.p: ( A) Effect of treatment with A. zerumbet extract in a dose of 200 mg/kg, p.o., or diclofenac (20 mg/kg, p.o.) on acetic acid-induced writhing (0.7%, 1 mL/100 g) in mice. ( B) Hot plate response latency (s) detected 1–4 h following administration of vehicle, extract (200 mg/kg, p.o.) or the reference standard, nalbuphine (10 mg/kg, p.o). Data is presented as mean ± S.E.M. (n = 5–8). * p < 0.05 vs. control values.
